description: France's highest court has overturned an arrest warrant issued in 2023 for the former Syrian president. However, it found that he can now be prosecuted, as he is no longer in office.

headline: 'If a dictator issued a call for tenders to reopen gulags, some consulting firms would be ready to bid'
description: Many consulting firms no longer hesitate to work on the most outrageous proposals, such as the mass displacement of Gaza residents or opioid overdosing. David Naïm, himself a consultant, wonders in his column how things have come to this point.

headline: At Musée d'Orsay, a Courbet painting gets a new life before visitors' eyes
description: The public is invited to witness the restoration of 'Un Enterrement à Ornans' and to meet the professionals working on the canvas.

headline: Paris's Georges-Vallerey pool combines a seaside resort with the Olympic spirit
description: 'Aquatic Monuments' (2/6). Throughout the summer, Le Monde brings you to public French pools with exceptional architecture. Built to host the 1924 Olympic Games, the Georges-Vallerey pool also served as a training venue for athletes during Paris 2024. Its original brutalist design is now softened by a retractable wooden roof, giving it the feel of a seaside resort.

headline: Montmartre residents denounce the Paris neighborhood's 'Disneyfication'
description: Rising numbers of tourists and increasingly exasperated residents have made coexistence difficult in Paris' 18th arrondissement, where the effects of overtourism are becoming ever more visible.

headline: In Israel, the heartbreak of Iranian Jews: 'My country was bombing my country'
description: The first direct war between Israel and Iran upended the lives of this small community, which has fought to preserve its culture after being forced to flee the Islamic Revolution in the 1970s.
